content.content: SES Weekly Status Update: SES Key Objective #2 - Education & Onboarding Initiative  960×540 423 KB   This Week’s Topic: Education & Onboarding Initiative  Join us here! on 2022-01-21T15:30:00Z  After presenting our high level road map last week, MakerDAO SES’s Wouter Kampmann @wouter will take a deeper dive into SES’s Q1 Objective #2, the Education & Onboarding initiative. Collaborating with Core-units across the DAO, SES plans to develop a network of content producers to build a more robust catalog of material that lowers the barrier of entry and welcomes outside contributors to support the protocol. We will discuss:  Cross-Core Unit Collaboration Enablement of Independent Contributors Upgrading SES Incubation Module Resources   @wouter will be presenting. Add the SES Status Update Call to your calendar  Other Updates  960×540 55.6 KB   Incubator News  960×540 58.7 KB   The TechOps Core Unit has 3 days left for ratification voting, with 87% of the vote in their favor.  Maker Talent presented this week on Core Unit Launch Pod Sessions, showcasing the incorporation of feedback provided on their MIP set (currently in RFC). MakerDAO SES has started the year with 3 new incubees. They are Maker Academy, Real-world Asset Compliance, and Real-World Asset Portfolio Incubator.   Maker Academy increases the proficiency of current/potential MakerDAO contributors and justifies the public adoption of MakerDAO’s products by both facilitating the production of expert-curated content and creating it themselves. SES Grant recipient Colby Anderson @colby joins the SES Incubator as the facilitator of this proposed core unit.  Real-world Asset Compliance is the vision of Luca Prosperi @luca_pro, another SES Grant recipient and author of Project Real-world Sandbox. Luca joins the incubator to begin implementing his research, and will push the DAO to draft the Real-world Asset Manifesto. The Real-world Asset Portfolio Incubator is in the early stages of incubation, and will serve as the knoweldge center for bringing in the needed outside expertise of asset classes required to grow off chain collateral types.    The MakerDAO SES Incubation Program is also evolving, read more about V2 below   Project Focus  1280×720 343 KB  MakerDAO SES presented on our last Weekly Status Update call the 1st quarter Objectives and Key Results. Below is a summary of the initiatives and projects our team will be undertaking in the first quarter of this year.  960×540 40.8 KB  The first objective of 2022 is to restructure SES’s Incubation & Grants programs. Both programs were very successful in their initial year, however the demands of the DAO are forcing these structured engagements to evolve. Incubation will be moving towards a “cohort” model, where we can increase the throughputs of participants by grouping them into similar tracks. Grants will soon be evolving into a bounty program. Instead of offering research and scholarship grants for anyone to self define their contribution, the program will evolve by placing rewards on delivering complete solutions to challenges and initiatives defined by SES.  960×540 39.3 KB  No spoilers here. Join our Weekly Status Update call to deep dive into this initiative.  Join us here! on 2021-01-21T15:30:00Z   960×540 32.9 KB  MakerDAO SES is merging two Q4 projects with our third objective of 2022. The Ecosystem Performance API & Dashboard will combine the research initiatives from Project X-ray with the goals from our DAO-wide Budget & Transparency improvement project. During the first quarter, our team will conduct stakeholder interviews to refine the vision for an Ecosystem Performance Dashboard, compile sources of the information, and work towards launching an MVP of the envisioned dashboard. Creating an accessible API is a major key result of this initiative to support access of the data by any interested party.  960×540 42.4 KB  MakerDAO SES Legal has a busy quarter planned. The primary key result the team is aiming to accomplish is the creation of the previously discussed Self-insurance Fund. This fund will mitigate legal risk for practical cases the DAO may face in the near future. Additional risk mitigation goals are defined as setting best-practices for Core Unit structures, and iterating on a MIP legal review process when ratifying proposals.  960×540 43.2 KB  The 5th objective MakerDAO SES has it’s sights set on is the restructuring of the Real-world Asset core unit. Project Real-world Sandbox provided deep insight into positioning Dai and MakerDAO among other well established tradfi players. In order to support entering the market, many different competencies and processes must be developed across the DAO. As a first step, Luca Prosperi @luca_pro joins the SES Incubator as the facilitator of the Real-World Asset Compliance Core Unit. Project Real-world Sandbox’s initial framework for evolving MakerDAO to support tradfi demands also includes the need of a Real-world Asset Legal, and Portfolio core units. Our key result of this objective is to incubate all three core units this quarter, positioning MakerDAO for a hot tradfi summer.  With the Community  960×540 19 KB    19.1 CULPS: Maker Talent   Recording Live!  Contacts  960×540 56.3 KB   Links  Discord Drive Notion   @ses-core-unit

960×540 54.9 KB   Incubator News  960×540 63 KB    Immunefi Security Core Unit  and Sidestream Core Unit MIPs are in Formal Submission.  Chaos Labs’ Blog Postis live on SES’s new Blog.  Also, watch their introduction video here.  Tech Ops Incubation Team has an introductory call tomorrow on SES’s Weekly Update call.   SES Weekly Status Update Spotlight: Sandbox Update  960×540 216 KB  The Tech Ops Incubation team will present their proposed core unit on SES’s Weekly Status Update call this Friday. Add the SES Status Update Call to your calendar: 2021-11-12T15:30:00Z  With the Community  960×540 32.9 KB   We have two calls planned for next week:   16.11  CULPS: ImmuneFi @ImmuneFi-team - Add to your Calendar!   17.11  CUT: Radicle.xyz  - Add to your Calendar!    And one future call planned in December:  15.12  CULPS: TechOps @TechOps-team   Project Focus  960×540 50.1 KB   Project Bullhorn has soft launched the SES Blog. Our first two posts are from Project X-Ray and Chaos Labs. Find our blog at SES.MakerDAO.network/blog   The SES Grants Pipeline is filling! Additional Research & Scholarship grants are in the works and will be announced soon.  Quick Updates  960×540 139 KB    @lollike joins the CES Core Unit on Monday! We will miss him and are excited to continue working with him in his new role!    Nikolaj joined Maker out of passion for crypto & blockchain tech. He said that work at the innovation lab at one of the largest fintech companies in Nordics was not hard on enough, so he joined Maker. Nikolaj has been a joy to work with providing technical expertise and structured, strategic support. He took initiatives in designing the incubation program and did lift a mountain of project management work with various incubee teams. Plus he is a nice person, great teammate and pleasant to be around. In one sentence, Nikolaj is an expert we will miss at SES. We are glad to see him stay in the Maker Ecosystem and look forward to collaborating with him in his new role at CES!    Huge thank you to @Lenkla from SES for coordinating the ENS Airdrop!    MakerDAO was named as a strategic partner and Lenkla took the initiative to coordinate the airdrop and direct the tokens to the Maker Protocol Pause Proxy. Maker received 46,296.30 ENS tokens (currently valued at over 2.5M DAI). Thank you!   Contacts  960×540 53.9 KB   Links  Discord Drive Notion   @ses-core-unit

You can find his post here.  SES Legal is working on a KYC / AML Compliance Research grant industry professionals experienced in legal and compliance law. An outline of the grant has been detailed on SES’s website. More details on this to follow in our next update.   SES Weekly Status Update Spotlight: Chaos Labs Incubation Team  960×540 381 KB  Chaos Labs will be presenting their Core Unit concept to the MakerDAO community this Friday 29.10 on the SES Status Update Call. Join us to learn more about this teams important mission. Watch @juan present the State of MakerDAO at LisCon here. . SES Weekly Status Update: KYC/AML Regulations & Compliance Grant Announcement  960×540 269 KB   This Week’s Topic: Research Grant Announcement: KYC/AML Compliance  Join us here! on 2021-01-28T15:30:00Z  MakerDAO SES Legal will be hosting this week’s update to announce the award of a research grant focused on KYC/AML Compliance. Patrizia Crespi @crypto_head joins SES Legal as a grantee. Using her 16 years of industry experience in the global banking industry, Patrizia will work to fortify MakerDAO’s legal infrastructure by first tackling KYC/AML regulations for virtual assets and virtual asset service providers. We will also preview the upcoming changes to the SES Incubator, by introducing the tracks planned for Season 1 of our Cohort model, with a focus on the legal track. Add the SES Status Update Call to your calendar  Other Updates  960×540 55.9 KB   Incubator News  960×540 61.3 KB   Join SES in welcoming the newest core unit to the DAO. The TechOps Core Unit ratification vote has passed with 89% voting in favor, 11% abstaining, and 0 no votes.  Maker Talent is in the final stages of updating their MIP set currently in RFC. A big thank you to everyone and their comments in support of refining the mission and mandate of Maker Talent. See a sneak preview of their updates here on the last CULPS call.    With the Community  960×540 24.2 KB    02.02 Focus On: RWF Restructuring  For this episode of Focus On, we will host Will Remor @williamr from the RWF Core Unit, and author of the Project Real World Sandbox Report, Luca Prosperi @luca_pro. Together, they will discuss the planned restructuring of the Real-World Finance Core Unit. The originally proposed Real-World Asset Core Unit framework discussed in Luca’s report is taking shape. Will & Luca will discuss their plan to incubate 3 new core units to support the DAO’s pursuit of servicing Real-World Assets on the protocol.  Join us  on 2021-02-02T00:00:00Z TIME: TBD  Contacts  960×540 56.3 KB   Links  Discord Drive Notion   @ses-core-unit

With the change of guard at dTalent CU, is everything still on schedule, or should the community expect a bit of a delay due to the transition? Thank you in advanced.

Hey, Frank. I believed we’ve discussed this already, but I’ll leave it here for everyone to read. The Incubator Program’s objective is to see successful, self-sustaining Core Units, and we draft a preliminary timeline with the team involved. Some teams might need more help on different tracks.  |814px;x361px;1739×912 137 KB  For more info, check @lollike’s presentation (with video) on this link. That said, it’s hard to evaluate “delays”, as the timeline for each project is adjusted on an ongoing basis based on the program. For the particular case of dTalent, we detected that a change was needed to get things moving and make sure that this Core Unit sees the light (rebranded to Maker Talent). We have been seeing a lot of progress (led by @manomad) and we’ll report on it soon.

Thank you for providing the details above Juan. I believe it is important that we All have transparency, this way the community can have confidence in the work that is being done–and I think SES does a nice of trying to provide this–so, yes–muchas gracias por todo.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Watch LayerZero introduce the idea on last week’s G&R meeting or join the discussion on the official post in MakerDAO’s forum. Luca Prosperi is an accomplished consultant, investor, and DeFi analyst launching “Real-World Sandbox”, a collaboration between Real World Finance and SES Core Units. Join us Friday 8.10 on SES’s Weekly Status Call to hear Luca present his plan and ask him questions. Join us: 2021-10-08T14:30:00Z! Here’s the link!
